results.title: Adolescence: the prolonged transition
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN
results.brief_description:
Episode number 19 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Through historical and cross-cultural comparisons, the extent to which the concept of adolescence as a period of increased autonomy, identity development, and risk-taking, is a social construction, is examined. The biological aspects of puberty and emerging sexuality are addressed. Observes examples of adolescents in transition from family to a broader adult world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN

results.title: Peer culture
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN
results.brief_description:
Episode number 18 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Explores two worlds children must negotiate during middle childhood and adolescence; the authority of adults and the co-operation of peers. The nature of the peer group as a microsociety is analysed through a look at “los abandonados”, a homeless and parentless group of children in Guatemala City who live in a completely peer-organized world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN

results.title: Learning & achievement
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
The role that learning plays in the lives of children, the functions of schooling and children’s orientation toward mastery and achievement are addressed as events surrounding the child’s first day of school in Japan, Russia, Brazil and the U.S. are observed. Discusses variables that enhance learning and promote competence.

results.title: Day care & the pre-school experience
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Overviews child care in modern industrialised societies and compares it to child care in hunter-gatherer and agricultural societies, emphasising the effect of child care on children.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN

results.title: Rivalry & interdependence in sibling relationships
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
An examination of sibling relationships showing siblings as allies, rivals and caregivers. The effects of birth order are discussed and the ways in which economics may both shape the values of families and define the roles of siblings. Discusses how prenatal behaviour can reduce stress that may accompany the birth of a new sibling.

results.title: Gender, early morality, & the self
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
The role of the family in the development of gender roles, moral emotions, prosocial behaviour and self concept are considered. Shows Children’s Day in Japan, boys and girls playing in a day care centre, and the way children’s behaviour outside the family, depends on how they have learned to act towards those in it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN

The role of the family in the development of gender roles, moral emotions, prosocial behaviour and self concept are considered. Shows Children’s Day in Japan, boys and girls playing in a day care centre, and the way children’s behaviour outside the family, depends on how they have learned to act towards those in it.
description_for_label:
Episode number 13 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
The role of the family in the development of gender roles, moral emotions, prosocial behaviour and self concept are considered. Shows Children’s Day in Japan, boys and girls playing in a day care centre, and the way children’s behaviour outside the family, depends on how they have learned to act towards those in it.

results.title: Interactive styles & attachment
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Discusses research concerning attachment relationships in terms of caregiver sensitivity, predictability and respect for children as individuals. Follows Italian pre-schoolers setting out to explore a cave and examines the effect of dependence on children’s ability to engage the world independently.

results.title: Responsive caregiving
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Explores caregiving and considers research on the effects of variations in sleeping, nursing, comforting and disciplining. Observes variations in caregiving in Japan, the U.S., Russia and among the Baka of Cameroon. Examines the importance of responsive interaction in building a positive relationship between the child and caregiver.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN

results.title: Concepts, memories & catagories
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Examines the cognitive changes occuring in children between 5 & 7 years. Reviews research on conceptual and memory development, logical reasoning and problem solving. Observes a Japanese child assuming family responsibilities, Russian children joining the Young Pioneers and Brazilian children participating in church rituals.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN

results.title: Symbol formation & acquisition of language
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
A child’s capacity to learn symbols is the first step to acquiring language. Through observations of a deaf family who converse in American sign language, and visits to a family with a child learning to speak, we are shown how language facilitates self-awareness and builds a child’s understanding of the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN
